item.title: Nuisance and blocking pavement parking, 2nd February
item.description:
7.5 ton recovery lorry reg.no.LX20XCK, make Isuzu,colour white ,based at Edmonton, N18 3QT, Phone number 0208 887 0333 belonging to C&S motors has been parking the lorry on the main road where there are 2 pavement parking on both sides.The length of the lorry covers the area of the pavement parking .While the lorry is parked there ,nobody can use the pavement parking.The road is narrow as it is.With the lorry parked there there is restriction for users of the road.They have to slow down to negotiate the road .Delivery and bin Lorries have difficulties going through.Emergency vehicles might have problems accessing .Minibusses carrying disabled passengers have broken wing mirrors of parked cars when passing through. The place where the lorry gets parked is outside No.33,35 and opposite 42. This has been going on for the last 6 months. The lorry is parked there for days and nights for days .It has been left at the same place for 2 to 3 weeks during the last few months.The driver of the vehicle lives 2 streets away. I would like my information to be anonymous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees are dying from the ivy, 2nd February
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious concern regarding the condition of several trees in the local park, which appear to be heavily overgrown with ivy. The ivy is climbing extensively up the trunks and into the canopies of the trees. As you may be aware, unmanaged ivy can significantly weaken trees by adding excess weight, increasing wind resistance, and restricting light and airflow. Over time, this can lead to structural instability, decay, and ultimately cause trees to fall. Given the proximity of these trees to nearby residential properties, paths, and public areas, there is a potential risk to public safety and property should any of the affected trees fail, particularly during strong winds or adverse weather conditions. I would kindly ask that the council arrange for an inspection of the affected trees and consider appropriate maintenance, such as controlled ivy removal, to prevent further damage and reduce the risk of falling trees. Thank you for your attention to this matter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
